The admission procedure will be carried out as per the rules prescribed by the Directorate of Technical Education, Government of Maharashtra, including the eligibility criteria, Please visit MAHACET website www.mahacet.org for eligibility and rules.

The candidate interested in securing admission under Institute Level quota and vacant seats (if any), in this college, should apply with the prescribed application form available in the college office as per the schedule notified by the college from time to time.

Contact Us: admissionumit21@gmail.com and office@umit.sndt.ac.in

select the category of student :- 
A.for Maharashtra State Candidate or 
B.for All India Candidate

patterns: what are the ELIGIBILITY-CRITERIA for Maharashtra State
responses:
Eligibility criteria for Maharashtra State Candidate :
The candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) Examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology /Biology/ Technical Vocational subject.

Secured minimum 45 % marks (minimum 40 % marks, in case of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability  candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only) in the subjects Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/ Technical Vocational subjects added together.

patterns: Eligibility Criteria for All India Candidates
what are the Eligibility Criteria for All India Candidates
responses:
Eligibility Criteria for All India Candidates (Maharashtra & OMS) :
Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) Examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology /Biology/ Technical Vocational subject.
Secured minimum 45 % marks (minimum 40 % marks, in case of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability  candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only) in the subjects Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/ Technical Vocational subjects added together.

patterns: What are the cut-off merit scores for different courses at the institute
responses:
The admission procedure will be carried out as per the rules prescribed by the Directorate of Technical Education, Government of Maharashtra, including the eligibility criteria, Please visit MAHACET website www.mahacet.org for eligibility and rules.

The candidate interested in securing admission under Institute Level quota and vacant seats (if any), in this college, should apply with the prescribed application form available in the college office as per the schedule notified by the college from time to time.
visit following link to know about previous years cut off:-https://www.umit.ac.in/_files/ugd/db66c0_af3ff755f6bf4ede8608b284deaa98c0.pdf
Please visit the UMIT website for further details. 
Contact Us: admissionumit21@gmail.com and office@umit.sndt.ac.in

select type of council: 
3.1 Technical council, 
3.2 Non-Technical council

patterns: how many technical councils are there in UMIT
responses:
UMIT has following Technical Councils.

3.a.Student's Council 

3.b.IEEE Council

3.c.CSI Council

3.d.ACM Chapter

3.e.Geek for Geeks Chapter

3.f.Developer Student Club 
Type name or given number of council to know futhure

patterns: how many members are there in  Students Council?
how many members are there in  Students Council?
responses:
The Student Council is the main student body of the college. It endeavors to improve the institute and a student's overall campus experience. The Council strives to solve the students' problems by acting as a liaison between the students and the faculty.

To know detail about Student's Council visit following link:-https://www.umit.ac.in/student-council-umit 

Also you can watch following youtube video :- https://youtu.be/jqJrOnetJ4I

patterns: how many members are there in IEEE Council?
what is full form of ieee
how many members are there in IEEE Council?
responses:
IEEE Chapter
IEEE is the world's largest professional association dedicated to advancing technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of humanity. IEEE and its members inspire a global community through IEEE's highly cited publications, conferences, technology standards, and professional and educational activities.  IEEE UMIT conducts a wide range of events aimed at providing a platform for its student members to interactively widen their network while developing their technical aptitude and inspire a sense of scientific inquisitiveness among them.

To know more about IEEE Council visit following link:https://www.umit.ac.in/ieee

Also you can watch following youtube video:https://youtu.be/o58pI96Jiwg

patterns: how many members are there in CSI Council?
how many members are there in CSI Council?
what is full form of csi
responses:
CSI Council
Computer Society of India is the first and largest body of computer professionals in India. It has 71 chapters across India, 418 student branches, and more than 90,000 members.  Usha Mittal Institute of Technology being a part of C.S.I. Mumbai Chapter organises various events and workshops throughout the year under the guidance of CSI Mumbai Chapter

To know more about CSI Council visit following link:https://www.umit.ac.in/csi

Also you can watch following youtube video:https://youtu.be/NRVbTp-dba4

patterns: how many members are there in ACM Council?
how many members are there in ACM Council?
what is full form of acm
responses:
ACM Council
The Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) founded in 1947, based in New York, USA, is the oldest body of computer professionals in the world. The Computer Science, Engineering and Management students of SNDT Womens University are part of the chapter since 1999. The SNDT-ACM Chapter is the first ACM Students Chapter in Mumbai. It aims to develop leadership qualities and management skills in addition to enhancing technical competence in the members. It has been the endeavor of the Chapter to bring innovation in its functioning so that it can reach out to broader spectrum of students and keep the chapter active.

To know more about ACM Council visit following link:,https://www.umit.ac.in/acm 

Also you can watch following youtube video:https:https://youtu.be/AXl68f_bgus

patterns: what is Geek for Geeks Chapter Council
how many members are there in Geek for Geeks Chapter Council?
how many members are there in gkg Council?
what is full form of gfg
responses:
GeekforGeeks UMIT Chapter
GeeksforGeeks UMIT Student Chapter is an ever growing community for students interested in Computer Science and other core technical competencies. It focuses on sharing knowledge in a peer-to-peer learning environment and learn building effective and optimized solutions for real world problems.

To know more about GFG Council visit following link:https://www.umit.ac.in/geekforgeeks

patterns: how many members are there in Developer Student Council?
how many members are there in dsc?
what is full form of Developer Student Council
responses:
Google Developer Student Club-UMIT
Google Developer Student Clubs of Usha Mittal Institute Of Technology, powered by Google Developers, is a learning community that aims to inspire intelligent minds in the field of technology. It is open to any student, ranging from amateur developers who are just starting to advanced developers to experts. It is a community for students to connect and collaborate as they solve real-world problems.

To know more about Developer Student Council visit following link:https://www.umit.ac.in/dsc

Also you can watch following youtube video:https://youtu.be/kEz_RwRBmCY

patterns: how many members are there in E-cell Council?
responses:
E-Cell Council
Elite, the entrepreneurship cell of UMIT, is a non-technical council which provides great opportunities for students to develop and enhance their entrepreneurial and management skills through various ingenious programs. The activities conducted by the E-cell council help, both the organizing as well as the participating students, gain confidence and improve their organizational, management, entrepreneurial, marketing, creative and leadership skills.\n\nTo know more about E-cell council visit following link:https://www.umit.ac.in/e-cell

Also you can watch following youtube video:https://youtu.be/0xhfUF5H0ts

patterns: how many members are there in nss ?
responses:
NSS Chapter
The NSS Unit of UMIT constantly seeks young volunteers to help channelize their energies and capabilities towards nation-building activities by organizing them into volunteers groups. National Service Scheme (NSS) has a vital role to play in the personality development of the Students and upliftment of society.  The NSS unit of Usha Mittal Institute of Technology is a force of committed students marching forward to make the world a better place to live in.

To know more about NSS Council visit following link:https://www.umit.ac.in/nss 

Also you can watch following youtube video:https://youtu.be/R1s6lywYuqg

patterns: how many members are there in UA2 ?
what is full form of ua2
responses:
UMIT Alumnae Association, is formed in order to foster new and strong bonds between the Alumnae, students and the teachers. It offers student-Alumnae contact, networking services and various events and reunions. 

The unit, as a whole, hopes to bring about a better change with the amalgamation of technology.\n\nTo know more about CSI Council visit following link:https://www.umit.ac.in/ua2

Also you can watch following youtube video:https://youtu.be/Xz5caEmqG2o

patterns: how many members are there in The Writers' Club ?
what is full form of  Writers' Club
responses:
The Writers' Club
The writers' club of UMIT is a literature club for the students. It initiated with the thought of adding a fun element to the student's life while fostering their creativity. The club has an integral part in creating the first-ever annual magazine for UMIT. The writers' club encourages the students to stimulate their ideas into ravishing articles. The club accepts all captivating pieces, including technical and non-technical writings.\n\nTo know more about CSI Council visit following link:https://www.umit.ac.in/thewritersclub

patterns: how many members are there in Sports Council?
responses:
Sports Council

Usha Mittal Institute of Technology has a vibrant sports council which encourage students to believe in themselves by providing them with a platform for participating in various Intra and Inter-Collegiate indoor and outdoor games. The Sports Council of Usha Mittal Institute Of Technology organized an Collegiate Sports Festival XUBERANCE. Our aim is to Encourage women in field of Sports.. 

 To know more about Sports Council visit following link:https://www.umit.ac.in/sports 

 Also you can watch following youtube video:https://youtu.be/PRG8x5hjjaU

UMIT is managed by SNDT Womens University.
UMIT is managed by SNDT Womens University.

CAP stands for Centralized Admission Process. It is conducted by the Directorate of Technical Education or Government of Maharashtra. Allotment of seats through CAP are not done by the institute. Seats are allotted through an online portal of DTE.

patterns: Why should I take admission at UMIT
responses:
Only autonomous engineering college in SNDT Womens University. 
Higher probability of placements.
Helping students to build overall personality by providing opportunity in the area of sports, cultural activities. 
The teachers are very well qualified and dedicated

CAP stands for Centralized Admission Process. It is conducted by the Directorate of Technical Education or Government of Maharashtra. Allotment of seats through CAP are not done by the institute. Seats are allotted through an online portal of DTE.

patterns: Can I take help from agents for application
responses: NO, Beware of agents for taking admission. We do not have an agent. Refer to the UMIT website regularly.

patterns: Is it mandatory to submit all required documents in original
responses: Yes. Your admission is confirmed only when you pay the fees as applicable and submit all the required documents in original. If you dont have all the originals while taking admission then you will be given some time to submit those documents.

patterns: Is it possible to change the branch in the second year
responses: Technically Yes. There should be a vacancy at that point of time. Allotment will be on a first year merit list basis. It is not recommended to take admission in a particular branch on the futuristic assumptions of change in branch.

patterns: I got very few marks and I'm not sure whether I will get admission at UMIT?
responses: Do not make assumptions based on prior cut-offs. You should apply and keep patience till the last cutoff date declared by DTE. Sometimes seat may get vacant at the last moment and you may get a chance to fill that seat. So do not lose hope.

patterns: I have not applied at UMIT and the admission process is over. Now will I get a seat at UMIT?
responses: No. Once the admission process is over then there is no further scope for admissions. However you should always see notifications by DTE.

patterns: When notification for Institute Quota admissions will come.
responses: Please visit the UMIT website for further details.

patterns: To whom should we contact for information related to vacant seats,document submissions, dates & deadlines, fees payment etc.
responses: type ADMISSION or Refer website www.umit.ac.in .

patterns: Am I eligible for any kind of scholarship or concession in fees?
responses: Yes. You are entitled for scholarship / concession fees depending upon the category / caste of the candidate and subject to the condition that you should have been admitted through CAP rounds only.

patterns: Can I get an Educational loan?
responses: Yes, several Banks offer Education Loans for payment of fees. Please contact Banks for more details in this regards

patterns: Which is the nearest bank to campus?
responses: Canara Bank is located in the campus.There are many banks located near the campus.

patterns: Is hostel accommodation provided at UMIT?
responses: Yes, Hostel allotment is strictly done on merit basis only due to limited availability of seats.

patterns: Are there any accommodation facilities nearby college?
responses: Yes. There are few private apartments and guest houses. You need to find accommodation on your own. However, if any help is required, the institute willtry to help you.

patterns: Do you have internet facilities at the college?
responses: Yes we do have an internet facility. Entire institute is WiFi enabled. Also the internet is available on all computers in the institute.

patterns: What is the average campus placement?
responses: UMIT has always been in the preferred list of industries for campus placement and on an average 80% students are placed every year.

patterns: Which are the companies that come here for recruitment?
responses: Accenture, Barclays, Colgate, Capgemini, Infosys, Microsoft, Deloitte, Oracle, Qunnox, Northgate, Nibble Technology, Xoriant, Persistent, Target, Ericsson, Mu Sigma.

patterns: What is the difference in placement policy between various branches?
responses: Placement policy is the same for all branches. In most of the companies students from all branches are eligible to apply; except few depending on the job profile.
Administrative offices remain open from 9.00 am to 5.00 pm. But classes start at 8.30 am.

patterns: Does the college follow a Semester or Annual system?
responses: the college follow a Semester pattern

patterns: What is the medium of instruction in class?
responses: English.

patterns: How are the teachers at UMIT?
responses: The teachers are very well qualified and dedicated. Many of them are Ph.D. or doing their Ph.D. All teachers are very helpful and proactive.

patterns: Are there any elective subjects offered during the programme?
responses: Yes.there elective subjects offered during the programme

patterns: How is the sports culture and extracurricular activities?
responses: We believe in the overall development of students. Apart from academics students are motivated to participate in extracurricular activities.

UMIT has been approved by the apex bodies like the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) and the Directorate of Technical Education (DTE). It envisages an educational complex with state of the art laboratories, workshops and computer center equipped with the latest equipment. It also envisions close liaison with the Industry and handling live Industry Projects as part of the curriculum.
 To know more about umit visit followng link:-https://www.umit.ac.in/about-umit

SNDT Womens University is the first Womens university in India as well as in South-East Asia. The University was founded by Maharshi Dr. Dhondo Keshav Karve in 1916 for a noble cause of Womens Education. The first five women graduated in 1921 from this University. The University Headquarters is in Churchgate Campus, Mumbai and the other two campuses of this University are at Juhu, Mumbai and Karve Road, Pune.
To know more about sndt visit following link:-https://www.umit.ac.in/about-sndt
